arlut.csd.ganymede.client
Class fieldoption_editor

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      arlut.csd.ganymede.client.fieldoption_editor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class fieldoption_editor
extends javax.swing.JFrame

This class displays the client "widget" that allows a user to edit the field options for a particular builder task. It's modeled loosely after the permissions editor widget, and uses the same TreeTable component.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

fieldoption_editor

public fieldoption_editor(field_option_field opField,
                          boolean editable,
                          gclient gc,
                          java.awt.Frame parent,
                          java.lang.String DialogTitle)
Parameters:
opField - The server-side field_option_field RMI reference this fieldoption_editor is to manipulate.
gc - The gclient that connects us to the client-side schema caches
parent - The frame we are attaching this dialog to
DialogTitle - The title for this dialog box
Method Detail

initRowTree

private javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode initRowTree()
                                                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
This method will create a tree of row info that will be used to store the field option values for the base and basefields. It returns a DefaultMutableTreeNode as the root of the tree structure

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

fixObjectBaseNodes

public void fixObjectBaseNodes(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode root,
                               FieldOptionModel model)
Loops over every object base node in the tree, setting its check-box state to what it should be based on the values of its fields
